meanings.sent1: She was pressurizing the dough to make it flat.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic was pressurizing the tire to the recommended level.
meanings.sent3: The chef was pressurizing the vegetables to bring out their natural flavors.
meanings.sent4: The teacher was pressurizing the students to complete their assignments on time.
meanings.sent5: The athlete was pressurizing the opponent with their aggressive play.

meanings.definition: To make someone feel pressured or stressed.
meanings.sent1: The strict deadline was pressurizing him to finish the project quickly.
meanings.sent2: The constant demands from his boss were pressurizing him at work.
meanings.sent3: The looming exams were pressurizing the students to study harder.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected news was pressurizing her to make a difficult decision.
meanings.sent5: The crowded room was pressurizing him, making him feel anxious.

meanings.definition: To increase the pressure within a closed system.
meanings.sent1: The engineer was pressurizing the tank to test its strength.
meanings.sent2: Pressurizing the cabin ensured a safe and comfortable flight.
meanings.sent3: The experiment involved pressurizing the container to observe the reaction.
meanings.sent4: Pressurizing the balloon made it expand and float in the air.
meanings.sent5: The process of pressurizing the pipeline required precision and caution.
